alert.note: Alert for Wicomico; Worcester (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 26 at 2:17PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Maryland, including the following counties, Wicomico and Worcester. * WHEN...Until 530 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 217 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ocean City, Berlin, Newark, Ocean Pines, Cape Isle Of Wight, Parsonsburg, Pittsville, Willards, Whaleyville, Showell, Bishop, Bishopville, Powellville, Ocean City Municipality, West Ocean City, Melson and Chesapeake Heights. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
